summary: This is an email chain from August 7, 2023, within the FBI's Office of the General Counsel regarding new administrative claims (SF95 forms) filed by victims alleging negligence related to the Epstein investigations. It discusses amending litigation holds and preserving physical files related to the FBI's investigation into Epstein and Maxwell (case number 50D-NY-3027571).

persons.name: Assistant General Counsel
persons.role: Assistant General Counsel, Litigation Branch, FBI Office of the General Counsel
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, instructing the recipient to preserve physical files related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation and noting they will amend litigation holds due to new victim claims.

events.title: Receipt of New Epstein Victim Claims
events.description: The FBI's Office of the General Counsel receives another SF95 (administrative claim) from a victim alleging negligence related to the Epstein investigations.

locations.address: 935 Pennsylvania Ave NW, Room 10140, Washington, DC 20535
locations.description: Address of the FBI Office of the General Counsel, Litigation Branch.

keyFacts: New administrative claims (SF95 forms) are being filed by victims alleging negligence related to the FBI's Epstein investigations as of August 2023.
The FBI's Litigation Branch is issuing or amending litigation holds to preserve documents related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation (FBI case 50D-NY-3027571).
The correspondence explicitly instructs that any physical files regarding the relevant investigations into Epstein/Maxwell must not be destroyed.
The document indicates ongoing legal activity and victim claims against the FBI years after the main Epstein case.
